TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in Bad LOC .

A summary account of historical events in which the present application originated can be found in the ORG ’s decision on admissibility in the case of ORG . PERSON GPE ( see ORG . PERSON GPE DATE . ) , no . ORG , DATE , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL- ... ) .
The applicant submits that he is an heir of PERSON , who was the owner of an impressive art collection . According to the applicant , PERSON was killed by the NORP in a mental hospital in DATE .

At the end of the Second World War the paintings belonging to the ORG collection were stored in different places which are now within the NORP territory . They were confiscated by ORG under LAW on ORG ( dekret o majątkach opuszczonych i poniemieckich – “ the DATE Decree ” ) as property belonging to NORP . At present the paintings are exhibited in various museums in GPE . The most important part of the ORG collection included the following paintings :
CARDINAL ) PERSON , PERSON of ORG .
On DATE the painting was taken to the FAC in GPE ( at present GPE in GPE ) . In DATE the painting was transferred to ORG at FAC .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , PERSON , GPE the GPE and an FAC .

In DATE the painting was on loan to ORG in GPE ( at present PERSON ) . On DATE it was taken to ORG ( at present FAC ) . After the war the NORP authorities confiscated it under the March CARDINAL Decree . It was taken to ORG .
CARDINAL ) Giovanni Filippo Criscuolo , PERSON with ORG and ORG .
Before the war the painting was in FAC in GPE . In DATE it was confiscated and taken to ORG .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , The Adoration of the Child and Crucifixion .
On DATE the painting was transferred to ORG . The NORP authorities confiscated it under the March CARDINAL Decree and took it to ORG .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , LOC in the LOC .

The painting was on loan to ORG in GPE . In DATE it was transported to ORG . After the war the NORP authorities confiscated the painting and took it to GPE . In DATE the painting was transferred to ORG in ORG .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , PERSON and PERSON .
The painting was loaned out to ORG in GPE . The NORP authorities confiscated it and took it to ORG . At present the painting is stored in ORG in ORG .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , ORG at the Pillar .
The painting was on loan to ORG in GPE . Since DATE it has been exhibited in ORG in ORG .
CARDINAL) PERSON , Lamentation .
The painting was loaned out to ORG in GPE . Since DATE it has been exhibited in ORG in ORG .
CARDINAL ) Portrait of a Family made by a Lombard painter in DATE .
Before the war the painting was being restored in FAC in GPE . After the war the NORP authorities confiscated it . It was taken to ORG in DATE .
CARDINAL ) PERSON , PERSON of a Doge .
During the war the painting was stored in GPE . After the war it was confiscated by the NORP authorities . In DATE it was taken to ORG at FAC .
Details concerning the former place of storage of other paintings are unknown . They were , however , recorded at ORG in GPE as belonging to the former ORG collection and are still there .
The applicant submits that he did not apply for restitution since under NORP law there is no possibility of challenging the validity and lawfulness of the confiscation and expropriation .
